text:
Hi! Is it possible to read External Object IDs that Data Sync integrations uses? For example the contact's or company's Salesforce ID or Odoo ID? I can't find that information from the list of properties and still HubSpot shows it under the sync settings.

PS. There is no specific channel for data sync, so I ask here. Let me know if there is a better place to ask.
I have discussed this with HubSpot support, but they repeatedly confuse this particular ID with custom properties. And I can't get any further.

Hey everyone :5065-hello:,

I wanted to send one last call to provide feedback on your experience with the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/automation/custom-workflow-actions|custom workflow action API> and any other wishlist items you have to build, customize, and manage automation for your apps in the <https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSegfw484-sfPWfRPy5Msn0jvy5cx4-ZH60O0l0XpdtyJaE9Gw/viewform|form here>.

I've gotten some great feedback and have had a few calls so far based on some of the feedback. Just want to ensure I continue to hear your requests!

hi - data sync PM here.
it's my dream to some day expose the values of what you're showing in that screenshot in an API. :slightly_smiling_face:

but I can already announce those ID's will be available in data sync's field mapping this quarter - the code is going through QA right now.

it's been particularly tricky to reliably expose those in a sync.

Hi Everyone! We're working on a workflow that calls a webhook and having trouble getting it over to our internal api endpoint: <htttps://dev-api.gohfd.com/integ/v0/sdc-settlement>

I recognize it can be a range of ip's and even multiple domains.  Is there a full list of domains it may fall under so we can set up a CORS policy to always allow HubSpot webhooks in?
